answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!I would suggest you consult a doctor ASAP. You either have some problem at the cervical vertebral level or in the brain. I would say cervical vertebral level is most likely like a pinched nerve, prolapsed disc, canal stenosis, slipped disc etc.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

Thank you for your suggestions. I have a hospital near me that has a free program. I made an appointment for Thursday. Hopefully, they will be able to run some tests and help me long term. I will keep you posted.

question: I have been controlling my type 2 diabetes with actos, lipitor, lisinopril, amaryl, and metfirman for the last  2 years. Recently, i was laying down and when I got up I felt my neck grinding. A few days later I noticed my tonuge was numb and tingling. then I noticed my right eye and right side of my face and head was numb. I have been having reduced mucle movement on that side. I do not have insurance and am unable to see a doctor. I get my diabetic medical treatment at a clinic. They are not equiped to handle nerve issues. We have a local hospital that takes people who cn not pay for services but it will take at least 3 weeks to get registard and make an appointment. should I wait for the appointment or should I try some other way to see a doctor immediately? Can anyone give me any advice.
title: facial numbness
